meanings.definition: To replace or repair panels on something.
meanings.sent1: I need to repanel my old car to make it look new again.
meanings.sent2: The workers will repanel the damaged wall to make it sturdy.
meanings.sent3: After the storm, the house looked like a puzzle missing pieces, so they had to repanel it.
meanings.sent4: She decided to repanel her life, starting with small changes that would make a big difference.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to repanel the canvas before starting a new painting.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter will repanel the door to make it more secure.
meanings.sent2: They had to repanel the stage for the upcoming play.
meanings.sent3: The robot malfunctioned and started to repanel itself, causing confusion among the scientists.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to repanel itself after the wildfire, with new growth sprouting everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The old house was repaneled with care, preserving its historic charm.
